main event: A silver, rectangular object was observed hovering in the sky over Stockton, California on 22 May 1952.
interesting points: The object was observed for about 5 minutes and was described as bright and silvery in color., It appeared stationary at first before fading away from sight., Witnesses speculated it could be a weather balloon despite its unusual characteristics., The object was observed at an altitude of approximately 30,000 feet., There were radar contacts made regarding the object, although the details were lost before interception.
witnesses: civilians, including a draftsman and an Army Reserve officer
